summary.project: OPEHRA: Operationalising Human Rights in the Design of AI-supported Digital Health
summary.summary: Karlstad University is seeking a highly motivated postdoctoral researcher for the KKS-funded project OPEHRA, which integrates human rights into AI-supported digital health systems. The project covers AI fairness, bias, and privacy aspects during the software engineering lifecycle, focusing on interdisciplinary collaboration and impact assessments of AI in health. Candidates should hold a PhD completed within three years of the application deadline, with experience in digital health systems, risk assessments, and interdisciplinary research.

required: PhD in Computer Science or closely related field
Familiarity with European legal frameworks for AI and data protection

requirements: Copy of PhD degree or completion details
Copy of doctoral thesis and relevant publications
